intro: Adenosma annamensis, commonly known as the Annam adenostigma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in cymes. Adenosma annamensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
